events.label: Marianopolis College
events.description: My CEGEP, where I got my DEC in Pure and Applied Sciences. Stressful times, but I learnt a lot! Sadly, lots of the science knowledge has started to slip away.

events.label: University of Waterloo
events.description: My (first) university, where I got a BAC in Computer Science. As much as I disliked the culture, coming here was the right choice for me, if only for co-op and forcing me to move away.

events.label: Paramount Commerce
events.description: My first work placement! Not the best job, but the first internship hardly ever is! I was just grateful to have the opportunity. Learned lots about unit/e2e testing and test automation.

events.label: Bunch.live
events.description: Game development was super fun! I loved learning Unity and C#, and I got addicted to MacBooks. The people I worked with were lovely! I would love to do a little solo game project some day...

events.label: Lifion by ADP
events.description: My first time working in frontend! Had no idea this would become my thing, but I quickly grew to love it! Worked with React and Redux. Sadly I didn't get to go to the New York office because of Covid!

events.label: Chalmers Universitat
events.description: I went on exchange here! I've been yearning for Europe ever since. It was one of most transformative experiences of my lifeâ€“ so much of who I am, I began to discover there.

events.label: Vivid Seats
events.description: My final work placement. Would've ended up here full time if I didn't have to move to Toronto! It's definitely where I found my confidence in what I do. Worked with React, Next.js, Optimizely. Great manager!

events.label: Hivestack
events.description: Where I'm working now! The people are really great here. It's the first time I've had "work friends". The situation with our parent company is quite problematic to me though.

events.label: Concordia University
events.description: My current university! Doing a second BAC in Film Studies. It's a nice change of pace, and film was always a passion of mine. My amazing manager lets me make up the hours I miss!
